examples: {COMMAND} can only be used in a server.
GUILD_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: {COMMAND} can only be used in my DMs.
DM_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: This command is locked to NSFW channels only!
NSFW_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: The {COMMAND} command is currently disabled in this server. You can not use it.
DISABLED_COMMAND.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that is disabled

examples: The {CATEGORY} category is currently disabled in this server. You can not use commands from this category.
DISABLED_CATEGORY.description: "{CATEGORY}" represents the category that is disabled

examples: Woah there! I'm missing {CLIENT_PERMISSIONS} permissions! Please give me said permission before using that command!
Woah there! You're missing {MEMBER_PERMISSIONS} permissions! Please get said permission before using that command!
Looks like you're missing {ROLES}! Make sure you get said role(s) before using {COMMAND}.
MISSING_ROLES.description: "{ROLES}" represents the missing roles required for the command. "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: You can't use {COMMAND}. It is locked to developers only.
DEVELOPER_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: {COMMAND} is locked to test servers only and this server is not one.
TEST_SERVER.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: Invalid Arguments [Too Many Arguments]; Please use {USAGE} instead
TOO_MANY_ARGS.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: Invalid Arguments [Too Few Arguments]; Please use {USAGE} instead
TOO_FEW_ARGS.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: {COMMAND} is on global cooldown! Please wait {COOLDOWN} before using it again.
GLOBAL_COOLDOWN.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used. "{COOLDOWN}" represents the remaining cooldown

examples: You are on cooldown! Please wait {COOLDOWN} before using {COMMAND} again.
USER_COOLDOWN.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used. "{COOLDOWN}" represents the remaining cooldown
